title: Hours after Trump announces truce: Israel says 3 killed in Iranian missile strike - Key developments
content: Amidst the Iran-Israel conflict, Donald Trump declared a ceasefire, which Iran promptly denied. Despite the denial, Iran confirmed its military operations ceased at 4 am Tehran time, following missile strikes on a US base in Qatar in response to attacks on its nuclear facilities. Tensions remain high as Iran's Supreme Leader asserts the nation's resilience.

title: Health scare mid-air: 11 fall ill on Air India London-Mumbai flight; food poisoning suspected
content: An Air India flight AI-130 from London to Mumbai faced a mid-air scare as several passengers and crew members reported feeling dizzy and nauseated. While initial reports suggested 11 were affected, Air India confirmed that five passengers and two crew members experienced discomfort.

title: Axiom-4: Nasa shares update; India's Shubhanshu Shukla targets liftoff tomorrow
content: Nasa has confirmed that the Axiom Mission 4 (Ax-4) to the International Space Station is now scheduled for launch on June 25, following earlier delays. Indian Air Force pilot Shubhanshu Shukla, representing Isro, will be the mission pilot, making him the second Indian in space after Rakesh Sharma. He will be accompanied by astronauts from Poland and Hungary.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 rallies past 25,200; BSE Sensex rises over 900 pts
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, soared in trade on Tuesday after Donald Trump announced a ceasefire between Iran and Israel.

title: Israel-Iran conflict: Indigo issues travel advisory; says 'considering safest flight paths'
content: Following escalating tensions in the Middle East, Indigo has issued a travel advisory, suspending flights to and from several destinations including Dubai, Doha, and Riyadh until at least 1000 hours. The airline is closely monitoring the situation and considering the safest flight paths, prioritizing passenger safety amidst regional unrest.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant equals Sachin's record, now only behind Rahul Dravid
content: Rishabh Pant made twin centuries at Headingley Test. He became the first Indian to score centuries in both innings of a Test in England. Pant joined India’s twin centuries club. His consistency in England earned him a special place. Pant equalled the record for the most sixes in a Test in England. The Headingley Test was historic for India.

title: 'He bowled to me in the nets': Tendulkar’s emotional tribute to Dilip Doshi will leave you teary-eyed
content: Former India left-arm spinner Dilip Doshi passed away in London at the age of 77 due to cardiac arrest. Sachin Tendulkar paid tribute, recalling their first meeting in 1990. Doshi played 33 Tests, taking 114 wickets, and was a stalwart in English county cricket, also representing Bengal and Saurashtra in the domestic circuit.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Straight ball hai, theke?';Pant’s self-check moment - Watch
content: Rishabh Pant dazzled in the first Test against England, showcasing his audacious talent. He scored a masterful century in each innings, becoming the first Indian to achieve this feat in England. Pant's innovative shots and candid self-talk, captured by stump mics, entertained fans.

title: Elon Musk’s simple life: World’s richest says will never own 5 things
content: Elon Musk, despite his immense wealth, maintains a surprisingly minimalist lifestyle. He sold numerous properties, opting for a small Boxabl home and even crashing at friends' places. Musk once lived on $1 a day and famously crashed a McLaren, never replacing it, showcasing his detachment from luxury possessions and focus on his ventures.

title: IND vs ENG: My Test avg hurts, but I don’t chase numbers now'- KL Rahul
content: Rahul's magnificent century, his sixth in SENA countries, combined with a crucial partnership with Rishabh Pant, propelled India to a commanding position in the opening Test against England. India set a daunting target of 371, fueled by strong batting performances throughout the innings.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan's Somil Mehta recommends buying Bharat Forge and National Aluminum. Bharat Forge, exhibiting a breakout from a consolidation pattern, is expected to continue its uptrend with targets at Rs 1350. Similarly, National Aluminum has broken out of a bullish flag pattern, projecting an upward movement towards Rs 215.

title: Surprise: How Bill Gates, Melinda Gates reacted; when daughter announced her startup
content: Phoebe Gates, daughter of Bill Gates, has launched Phia, an e-commerce app co-founded with Sophia Kianni. The platform utilizes AI to compare prices across numerous websites, offering users a comprehensive view of both new and second-hand fashion items. Bill Gates initially expressed concern about potential financial requests and involvement but ultimately supported Phoebe's entrepreneurial endeavor.

title: US judge blocks Trump's order on Harvard - What it means for foreign students
content: In a victory for Harvard University, a US federal judge has issued a second injunction against the Trump administration's efforts to restrict international students. The ruling allows foreign students to continue their studies in the US, despite the administration's attempts to pressure Harvard over its policies.

title: ‘Censored before release?’: Diljit reacts to row over Hania Aamir casting
content: Diljit Dosanjh's cryptic Instagram post, "Censored before release?" sparks speculation about his film 'Punjab 95', which faces censorship hurdles regarding its portrayal of human rights activist Jaswant Singh Khalra's life. Simultaneously, 'Sardaar Ji 3' bypasses Indian theaters due to backlash over casting Pakistani actress Hania Aamir amidst India-Pakistan tensions, highlighting ongoing debates about cross-border collaborations in the film industry.

title: Meerut: 13-year-old dalit patient raped at top govt hospital; sparks security concern
content: A 13-year-old Dalit girl, admitted for knock knees at a Meerut hospital, was allegedly sexually assaulted in the women's washroom by a 20-year-old attendant. The accused, Rohit Kumar, was arrested after the girl's mother filed a complaint.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ Box Office collection day 4: Aamir Khan’s film nears Rs 70 crore mark in India
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par' had a strong opening weekend, grossing Rs 66.65 crore in four days, despite a Monday dip. The film has already surpassed the lifetime collection of Aamir's previous film 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. Genelia Deshmukh also celebrates a career milestone as the film becomes her highest-grossing movie, exceeding 'Jaane Tu... Ya Jaane Na'.

title: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari threatens India over Indus Waters Treaty suspension
content: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari has warned India against unilaterally suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, asserting Pakistan's resolve to protect its water rights. He stated that Pakistan would be compelled to respond if India violates the treaty, potentially leading to conflict. He also urged India to resume dialogue, particularly on counterterrorism, to foster regional stability and mutual trust.

title: Former India spinner Dilip Doshi passes away at 77
content: Former Indian left-arm spinner Dilip Doshi passed away in London at the age of 77 due to cardiac arrest. Doshi represented India in 33 Tests and 15 ODIs between 1979 and 1983. The Saurashtra Cricket Association mourned the loss of Doshi, remembering his dedication and skill. He was a match-winner, achieving 114 Test wickets and 898 first-class wickets.

title: 'Two good': Sanjiv Goenka lauds Pant's aggression, gives special mention to KL Rahul
content: Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka lauded Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul for their centuries against England at Headingley. Pant became the second wicketkeeper ever to score centuries in both innings of a Test, while Rahul hit a patient 137.

title: Mughal Road gets tunnel, Omar Abdullah says ‘major achievement of my govt’
content: The Union government has approved 19 road and tunnel projects worth Rs 10,637 crore for Jammu and Kashmir, including the crucial Peer Ki Gali tunnel on the Mughal Road. This tunnel will provide year-round connectivity between Kashmir and Jammu, offering an alternative to the Srinagar-Jammu national highway. The projects also include the Sadhana Tunnel, connecting Kupwara with Karnah.

title: Trump in situation room: US monitoring Iran strike on base in Qatar, says White House - Report
content: Following Iran's missile strike on Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar, President Trump is in the Situation Room with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth and General John Caine. The team is actively monitoring the escalating situation as tensions rise in the Gulf region.

title: US-Iran tensions: Iran launches missiles at US base in Qatar - top developments
content: Iran launched six missiles at the US-operated Al Udeid Air Base in Qatar, causing explosions across Doha and Lusail. This attack, confirmed by Iranian state TV, followed Qatar's airspace closure and recent US-Israeli strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. While no immediate casualties were reported, embassies urged citizens to stay indoors as regional tensions escalate.

title: IND vs ENG: 'You just let Pant be Pant' - Rahul hails star batter after twin tons
content: At Headingley, KL Rahul and Rishabh Pant's spectacular centuries powered India to a formidable 364 in their second innings, setting England a challenging 371-run target. Pant's twin centuries etched his name in history, while Rahul's composed innings anchored the batting display. Despite a late collapse, India's dominant performance has set the stage for a thrilling final day.

title: India enters top 100 in global Sustainable Development Goals rankings for first time
content: India ranks 99th on the 2025 SDG Index with a score of 67, while China ranks 49th with 74.4 and the US 44th with 75.2 points.

title: Flight disruptions to continue, although airspaces in West Asia reopened
content: Additional seating arrangements for passengers and counters for airlines are being set up in Terminal 2 of the Thiruvananthapuram International Airport to handle the situation

title: Eluru man becomes Andhra Pradesh’s first para-swimmer to conquer English Channel, Palk Strait
content: Balaga Ganesh (38) was part of the ‘Pride of India – A Team’, a six-member relay team that successfully swam across the English Channel, covering a distance of 34 km from England to France in the Atlantic Ocean on June 16.

title: Indrakeeladri temple development gains momentum; master plan, land protection in focus
content: Efforts under way to secure Central support under the PRASAD scheme to boost Sri Kanaka Durga temple tourism infrastructure, says Endowments Minister

title: Ward Secretariat staff submit representations to Collector over promotions and transfers
content: Many employees in Ward Secretariats, who have completed five years of service and are eligible for promotion, have not been promoted so far, pointed out Subhani, who has completed six years of service.

title: Several flights cancelled from Bengaluru, five flights diverted
content: Airport sources said that the flights that were diverted to KIA departed after air space opened at 3 am.

title: Bombay Bar Association slams ED summons to senior advocates, warns of legal action
content: The Bombay Bar Association has strongly condemned the Enforcement Directorate for issuing summons to Senior Advocates Arvind Datar and Pratap Venugopal. Though the summons were later withdrawn, the Association called the move a serious threat to the independence of the legal profession.

title: Unemployed youth move Bombay High Court over delayed induction despite appointment letter
content: Sumedh Shivaji Jadhav, a qualified youth from Sindhudurg, has approached the Bombay High Court after being denied joining despite receiving a government-backed job appointment. His petition highlights bureaucratic inaction and seeks urgent redress for months of unemployment.

title: IIT Bombay scientists develop solar heat battery for freezing Himalayan homes
content: Researchers at IIT Bombay have developed a solar-powered thermochemical battery using strontium bromide that can store summer heat and release it in freezing Himalayan winters. The system offers a clean, cost-effective alternative to diesel heating in remote, high-altitude regions.

title: NCP demands stern action against Abu Azmi’s ‘wari‘ remark
content: The Nationalist Congress Party has condemned Samajwadi Party leader Abu Azmi’s remarks about ‘wari’ and called him a “toxic element” in the State who is repeatedly engaging in inflammatory statements to disrupt harmony.

title: Centre approves ₹10,637-crore road, tunnel projects for Kashmir
content: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari approves 19 road and tunnel projects worth ₹10,637-crore for Jammu and Kashmir, improving connectivity and infrastructure

title: TMC accuses Centre of not releasing funds for Ghatal flood management plan
content: The Ghatal Master Plan is a comprehensive flood management scheme by the West Bengal government, aimed particularly at flood-prone areas in Purba Medinipur and Paschim Medinipur

title: Deadline for exercising option under Unified Pension Scheme extended
content: The Finance Ministry extends UPS option exercise deadline to September 30, 2025 for government employees under National Pension System

title: ‘Beej Utsav’ highlights role of indigenous seeds in agricultural sustainability
content: Held in the tribal belt at the tri-junction of Rajasthan, Madhya Pradesh, and Gujarat, participants at the ‘seed festival’ were apprised of the significance of seed heritage, biodiversity, and climate consciousness

title: India slams OIC for ‘incorrect’ remarks that reflect ‘Pakistan’s influence’
content: The MEA said the OIC's repeated failure to acknowledge the documented threat of terrorism emanating from Pakistan reflects a wilful disregard for facts

title: Two J&K residents held for displaying U.S., Israel flags
content: A police spokesman said the two individuals were detained for installing foreign flags during night hours in an apparent attempt “to disturb public peace and order”

title: Kanishka bombing 1985 stresses need for zero tolerance to terrorism: Jaishankar
content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri leads Indian team to Cork, Ireland where a solemn ceremony was held at Ahakista, to remember those who perished in the terror bombing that took place on June 23, 1985

title: Bring back woman deported to Pakistan: J&K High Court
content: Human rights are the most sacrosanct component of a human life, says Judge in a June 6 order; petitioner from Pakistan had been staying in Jammu for the past 38 years with her husband and two children

title: Final decision on three-language formula only after consulting all stakeholders, says CM Fadnavis
content: The consultation process should be conducted with all stakeholders, including Marathi language scholars, literary figures, and political leaders, says the State Government

title: GI application filed for Balanagar Custard Apple
content: The scientific documentation of the Balanagar Custard Apple’s unique agro-morphological characteristics shows how its cultivation in a non-commercial manner in areas that are not irrigated marks it out.

title: Raja Raghuvanshi murder: Meghalaya Police arrest eighth accused from Gwalior for destruction of evidence
content: Lokendra Singh Tomar was arrested in Gwalior for allegedly concealing and destroying evidence; he is the owner of the apartment in Indore where Sonam Raghuvanshi, Raja’s wife had stayed following his murder

title: Adani Airports Gets $1 Billion Financing For Mumbai International Airport
content: Mumbai International Airport Ltd, a subsidiary of Adani Airport Holdings, has secured a $750 million investment from a group led by affiliates of Apollo-managed funds and other long-term backers, the US private capital group said on Monday.

title: NASA Says Launch Of Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom Space Mission Likely Tomorrrow
content: After repeated delays,NASA has now announced that Indian Astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla could fly to space tomorrow.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: Israel Says Iran Launched New Attack As US Celebrates "Historic Ceasefire"
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: A series of powerful explosions rocked Tehran early Tuesday morning, hours after US President Donald Trump announced that Iran and Israel have agreed to a staggered ceasefire.

title: Iran Hints At Truce With Israel, "Historic Ceasefire," Says US
content: Iran Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi, in a post on X, thanked Tehran's armed forces for "fighting until the very last minute".

title: "Get Me Bibi": How Trump Brokered Ceasefire In Call With Netanyahu
content: President Donald Trump brokered a ceasefire agreement between Israel and Iran on Monday in a call to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and with Trump's team in contact with Iranian officials, a senior White House official said.

title: "12-Day War Ends": Trump Announces Israel-Iran Ceasefire
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Monday that a "complete and total" ceasefire between Israel and Iran will go into force with a view to ending the conflict between the two nations.

title: Trump's Plan To Shut Harvard's Doors To Foreign Students Hit By US Judge
content: A federal judge on Monday blocked President Donald Trump's administration from implementing his plan to bar foreign nationals from entering the United States to study at Harvard University.

title: Son Of Iranian Leader Khamenei Is Hardliner With Backroom Influence
content: Mojtaba Khamenei is one of the most influential figures in the Iranian clerical establishment headed by his father, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and among the figures seen as a candidate to succeed him as leader of the Islamic Republic.

title: Trump Thanks Iran For "Notice" Before Attack On US Base, Then A Peace Note
content: US President Donald Trump signalled today that Iran's attempted air strike at the US-run Al Udeid air base in Qatar would not draw a retaliation from Washington.

title: In Meeting With Chinese Foreign Minister, Ajit Doval Calls For Countering Terrorism
content: In an oblique reference to Pakistan's support to cross-border terrorist activities, NSA Ajit Doval emphasised the need to counter terrorism in all its forms for regional peace and stability during a meeting with Chinese Foreign Minister in Beijing.

title: Actor Srikanth Sent To Judicial Custody Till July 7 In Drugs Case
content: Popular Tamil and Telugu film actor Srikanth has been remanded to judicial custody till July 7th by a Chennai court in connection with a cocaine-related case.

title: Iran Attacks US Base In Qatar's Doha With Missiles In Retaliation
content: Iran on Monday fired missiles aimed at an American base in Qatar, the largest strategic asset of the US army in the West Asia region, in retaliation to the attack on its nuclear sites over the weekend.

title: JD Vance Says Iran Is Now "Incapable" Of Building Nuclear Weapon
content: U.S. Vice President JD Vance said on Monday Iran was no longer able to build a nuclear weapon after U.S. strikes destroyed its infrastructure.

title: Trump Says He Expects Israel-Iran Ceasefire To Last Forever
content: U.S. President Donald Trump told NBC News he expects an Israel-Iran ceasefire that he announced on Monday to last "forever."

title: US Supreme Court Allows Trump To Resume Deportations To Third Countries
content: A divided US Supreme Court paved the way on Monday for the Trump administration to resume deportations of undocumented migrants to countries that are not their own.

title: UK PM Says Britain Commits To NATO 5% Spending Target
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced Monday that Britain was committed to spending five percent of its economic output on defence, in line with a pledge set to be announced by NATO at a summit in the Netherlands.

title: "Will Respond Again In Case...": Iran Warns US After Attack On Qatar Base
content: Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi said on Monday that Tehran's attack on U.S military base al-Udeid in Qatar came in response to the U.S. "aggression against Iran's territorial integrity and sovereignty."

title: Man Kills Friend Over Suspected Affair With Wife In Noida, Arrested: Cops
content: A man was arrested for allegedly killing his friend, suspecting him of having an affair with his wife, police said on Monday.

title: Iran Attacks US Air Base: What We Know So Far
content: Iran launched missiles toward America's Al-Udeid base in Qatar today in response to the US strikes on the nuclear facilities of Tehran. The Iranian Armed Forces said the base was targeted with a powerful missile attack in Operation Beshararat Fatah.

title: Israel-Iran War LIVE Updates: "14 Missiles Fired, 13 Knocked Down, 1 Set Free": Trump On Iran's Attack
content: US-Israel-Iran Conflict LIVE Updates: The United States carried out a "very successful attack" on three nuclear sites in Iran, President Donald Trump said.

title: KL Rahul didn't just bat with Rishabh Pant — he watched over him, like an elder brother would
content: With their own means and ways, the two drove India into a position of control. KL Rahul continued to be patient, calm and left the ball as well as anyone has in this part of the world. Rishabh Pant, meanwhile, entered a period of self-talking where he calmed himself to weather the early storm and then returned to maverick ways before making timely returns to sensibility.

title: 'No threat to brotherly Qatar': Iran says used same bomb count as US
content: In a retaliatory move, Iran targeted a US base in Qatar on Sunday evening, following America's alliance with Israel in the conflict against Tehran. Iran's security body declared that the attack mirrored the scale of US strikes on Iranian nuclear sites. Reuters reported the base's location away from Qatari urban and residential zones.

title: BJP MLA supporters assault passenger over window seat - watch video
content: Supriya Shrinate, a Congress leader, has made accusations against Rajeev Singh, a BJP MLA. She alleges he orchestrated an assault on a train passenger. The incident reportedly occurred on the New Delhi–Bhopal Vande Bharat Express. The dispute arose over a window seat. The Uttar Pradesh BJP has issued a show cause notice to Singh. He is asked to provide a written explanation. Singh claims the co-passenger misbehaved with his family.

title: Ayatollah So: How Donald Trump helped Iran supreme leader reclaim the narrative
content: American B-2 bombers attacked Iranian nuclear facilities at Fordo, Natanz, and Isfahan. Donald Trump claimed complete obliteration of Iran's nuclear infrastructure. Israel followed with strikes on missile sites. The attack strengthened the Iranian regime. It reignited anti-American sentiment. Experts fear Iran may accelerate its pursuit of nuclear weapons. Global oil prices surged amid wider conflict fears.

title: India, Pakistan extend airspace ban for each other till July 24
content: As per the NOTAM, Indian airspace will not be available for Pakistan-registered aircraft and aircraft operated, owned or leased by Pakistan airlines and operators, including military flights

title: Bag containing bullets create flutter in Srisailam
content: Workers, while cleaning the town, found a red bag containing the bullets lying adjacent to the road divider in front of Vasavi Guest House

title: Lack of funds has put Karnataka MLAs in a spot, Congress leaders feel
content: While Kagwad MLA Raju Kage threatens to quit his membership of the Assembly over the slow pace of works, Sagar MLA Belur Gopalakrishna seeks resignation of Housing Minister Zameer Ahmed Khan

title: Global politics dictated by realism and self-interest and not solidarity: V-P Jaideep Dhankhar
content: Speaking at the launch of a book written by senior RSS leader Ram Madhav, the Vice-President calls for a shift in India’s foreign policy imagination, says this is the right time to move beyond ‘romanticism’ and focus on economic and strategic strength

title: Trade unions question Railway Board’s decision to re-engage retired staff
content: Criticism comes after the Railway Board issued an order on June 20 empowering Divisional Railway Managers to appoint retired staff as volunteers in non-gazetted posts

title: Centre using technology to exclude vulnerable sections: Congress on face authentication for anganwadi beneficiaries
content: The Women and Child Development Ministry had directed all States and Union Territories (UTs) to implement a mandatory face recognition system for take-home ration distribution and child attendance monitoring at anganwadi centres

title: AAP wins Ludhiana bypoll in Punjab; political circles see it as a face-saving victory
content: Congress candidate and working president of the State unit in Punjab resigns in the aftermath of the results

title: A.P. seeing welfare, development under NDA rule, says Purandeswari
content: After five years of bad governance, the people in the State elected good government: BJP State president

title: Shashi Tharoor’s praise of PM Modi exposes Rahul Gandhi: BJP
content: Mr. Tharoor wrote in The Hindu that Modi’s ‘energy, dynamism and willingness to engage was a prime asset for India on the global stage’ and it deserved more backing

title: Trinamool Congress wins Kaliganj Assembly by-election, BJP sees silver lining
content: After the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, byelections to 11 Assembly constituencies have been held in the State and the Trinamool Congress won all the 11 seats

title: Naidu unveils Swarna Andhra Vision, a blueprint for reconstruction, inclusive growth
content: NDA alliance’s historic electoral win is a mandate for reconstruction, says CM setting forth a roadmap for State on the first anniversary of the NDA government

title: West Bengal CM meets new Bangladesh High Commissioner at State Secretariat
content: According to officials present at the meeting, the deliberations were held in a “warm and cordial atmosphere” and the Chief Minister reflected her ideas on development of people with the Bangladeshi envoy

title: Indian private sector in ‘developing’ stage: Jitendra Singh
content: Several projects have been rolled out but we don’t have the private sector acumen, the Science, Space and Atomic Energy Minister says, adding that it will require some time and capacity building has started

title: Ruling National Conference sets up human rights wing in J&K
content: The cell will document cases of rights violations and ensure the human rights of locals are protected, says National Congress chief Farooq Abdullah. He reiterates demand for restoration of Statehood to J&K, while dismissing rumours about conditional restoration of Statehood

title: More than 20 targets were identified under Operation Sindoor
content: Modi and Rajnath held detailed discussions with intelligence and defence forces after the list of targets was drawn up; India attacked nine of them later

title: Operation Sindoor met all objectives, instilled fear in terrorists, says Rajnath
content: Defence Minister releases book on President Murmu’s speeches; praises her as the ‘best example of women-led development’ in India

title: UDF unity pays off, anti-incumbency hurts LDF
content: In the intensely contested byelection, where both the UDF and the LDF invested heavily in resources and campaigning, anti-incumbency sentiment proves pivotal to UDF candidate Aryadan Shoukath’s victory

title: Assembly bypolls: AAP retains both seats; BJP, Congress, Trinamool bag one each
content: The Congress wrests Nilambur in Kerala from the LDF-backed candidate, while in West Bengal, the ruling Trinamool Congress has won the Kaliganj seat amid a myriad of controversies and protests

title: My life is in danger, says Lalu’s elder son Tej Pratap
content: He rejected the speculation of forming a separate political party ahead of the Assembly election. RJD chief Lalu Prasad on May 25 expelled his son from the party and snapped all family ties with him, stating that his actions were ‘irresponsible’ and not in accordance with public conduct

title: Our jawans will win the war against Maoism, says Shah
content: Home Minister says Maoist violence deprived the poor tribal population of basic necessities such as food, electricity, education, housing, toilets, and clean drinking water — let alone any possibility of industrial development

title: Doval begins China visit for SCO meet, Rajnath to arrive this week
content: First batch of Kailash Mansarovar yatris reach Tibet; New Delhi-Beijing exchanges expected to lead to resumption of direct flights and Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s scheduled visit to China for the SCO Summit in August, say officials.

title: Tamil actor Srikanth arrested for allegedly buying cocaine from a drug cartel
content: A senior police officer confirmed the arrest and said Srikanth had been in regular contact with three drug offenders who were arrested recently

title: Telangana’s VeriFast app sets national benchmark in passport verification
content: Director General of Intelligence B. Shivadhar Reddy to receive the Certificate of Excellence in New Delhi from the Minister of External Affairs

title: BJP president J.P. Nadda pays tribute to Syama Prasad Mookerjee
content: The BJP chief said the Bharatiya Jana Sangh founding president had ‘made the supreme sacrifice while opposing Articles 370 and 35A, which granted special status to Jammu and Kashmir’

title: Rythu Bharosa disbursement to be completed today
content: Agri. Minister Tummala Nageswara Rao sayd ₹8,285 cr credited to bank accounts of 67.01 lakh landholders in just 7 days

title: Sources: Celtics trading Holiday to Trail Blazers
content: The Celtics are trading Jrue Holiday to the Trail Blazers for Anfernee Simons and two second-round draft picks, sources told ESPN on Monday night.

title: Haliburton on playing injured: 'I'd do it again'
content: Indiana Pacers star Tyrese Haliburton said he didn't regret playing through a calf strain that led to a torn right Achilles tendon in Game 7.

title: Padres' Tatis sues BLA to void future earnings deal
content: Padres star Fernando Tatis Jr. filed a lawsuit Monday against Big League Advance in an attempt to void the future earnings contract he signed as a 17-year-old minor leaguer that could cost him $34 million.

title: Sources: Mavs to extend Gafford on $60M deal
content: Dallas Mavericks center Daniel Gafford intends to sign a three-year contract extension worth nearly $60 million, sources told ESPN.

title: Miami advances to CWC last 16, will face PSG
content: Inter Miami lost a 2-0 lead that would have secured first place in their group, but  Lionel Messi's team advanced to the knockout stag to face European champions Paris Saint-Germain.

title: 5-year sentence sought for Franco; verdict Thu.
content: Dominican prosecutors have asked a judge to sentence the Rays' Wander Franco to five years in prison for alleged sexual abuse of a girl who was 14 at the time. A final decision in the case will be issued Thursday.

title: Sources: Wiz's Middleton picks up $33.3M option
content: Wizards three-time NBA All-Star Khris Middleton has picked up his $33.3 million player option for the 2025-26 season, sources told ESPN.

title: Reds DFA Candelario halfway through $45M deal
content: The Reds reinstated infielder Jeimer Candelario from the injured list Monday and designated him for assignment.

title: 'We are Vegas' team': A's begin building stadium
content: The A's on Monday celebrated the groundbreaking of their new $1.75 billion, 33,000-person capacity ballpark in Las Vegas that is expected to be finished in time for the 2028 season.

title: 🔁 Redrafting MLB draft top-10 picks, 2015-24
content: Witt over Rutschman? Does Skenes still go No. 1? Let's go back in time to right the wrongs of the past 10 MLB drafts.

title: New NBA mock draft, two days before Round 1: Latest buzz on the chaotic top-10 picks
content: Will the 76ers, Hornets and Jazz take best-player-available approaches? We project both rounds of the NBA draft.

title: Why this Thunder big 3 might be the one to start a dynasty
content: When the Thunder set out to build a champion, they learned hard lessons from how their historic trio of KD, Russell Westbrook and James Harden flamed out a decade ago.

title: How close is your team to an NBA title? We tiered all 30 franchises
content: While the world watched the Finals, the league's hierarchy shifted. Is OKC already looking over its shoulder ?

title: Club World Cup Daily: Messi's Miami book showdown with PSG
content: Leo Messi's Inter Miami have made it to the knockouts, where they'll face PSG, while Atletico are the first big team to go home early. Here's what you need to know from Monday's Club World Cup action.

title: Buzz: How Blackhawks, Isles, Predators could shake up first round
content: The first round is Friday. Our reporters pass along the latest intel they're hearing from around the league.

title: 5 things we've learned about the 'freaking awesome' NL West
content: The most dynamic division in baseball has been tons of fun so far. After 17 games in 18 days, here are five lessons.

title: Why 'treatment of families' matters to NFL players -- and where some teams fall short
content: From the Vikings (A+) to the Bengals (F-), we asked players what the expectations are in team treatment of their families.

title: Why empty seats litter Club World Cup, Gold Cup
content: Little more than a week into the summer of soccer, and some of the defining images of the Club World Cup and Gold Cup have been seas of empty seats.

title: Wrexham legend Paul Mullin leaves club on loan
content: Paul Mullin, the poster boy of a Wrexham team soaring through England's football leagues following their takeover by Hollywood celebrities, has left the club to join League One side Wigan on a season-long loan deal.

title: City's Lewis has CWC ban extended by 2 games
content: Rico Lewis will miss Manchester City's next two games at the Club World Cup after his ban was extended following his red card against Wydad AC.

title: Source: Barça close in on Roony Bardghji transfer
content: Barcelona are close to completing the signing of Copenhagen FC winger Roony Bardghji, a source has told ESPN.

title: Chelsea feel no pressure to win $130M CWC prize
content: Enzo Maresca said Chelsea are not under any financial pressure to lift the Club World Cup despite the £97million on offer to the winner.

title: Sources: Milan's Hernández nears Al Hilal move

title: Jets owner Johnson agrees to buy Palace stake
content: New York Jets owner Woody Johnson has agreed on a £190 million deal ($254m) to buy a 43% stake in Premier League team Crystal Palace from American businessman John Textor, the club announced on Monday.
